net.sf.jlinkgrammar
Class Postprocessor

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.jlinkgrammar.Postprocessor

public class Postprocessor
extends java.lang.Object

O.K. is this a static class? No it is used in the dictionary instance object which is then copied to the Sentence instance object, and then to the various Linkage instance objects. The programmmer will have to pay special attention to acertain wich postprocessor is used on any given linkage.

Method Detail

post_process_match

static boolean post_process_match(java.lang.String s,
                                  java.lang.String t)
string comparison in postprocessing. The first parameter is a post-processing symbol. The second one is a connector name from a link. The upper case parts must match. We imagine that the first arg is padded with an infinite sequence of "#" and that the 2nd one is padded with "*". "#" matches anything, but "*" is just like an ordinary char for matching purposes. For efficiency sake there are several different versions of these functions

post_process_close_sentence
